quest.name: Throw Some Rings on It
journal: Serendipity believes you are ready for a new kind of challenge.
Serendipity has tasked you with your first official commission. Craft a dozen handfuls of copper rings and present them to her for inspection.

In a surprising turn of events, Gigi compliments your craftsmanship, albeit in a tremendously condescending manner. Serendipity bids you deliver the copper rings to the client, a Sultansworn named Robert, who should be waiting just outside the Goldsmiths' Guild.
Robert thanks you for the delivery, and states that the full payment will be delivered to the guild in short order. Relay his words to Serendipity.

Serendipity's eyes light up with joy upon hearing the Sultansworn's words. After regaining her composure, she suggests that you start accepting independent commissions by speaking with Eustace at the Quicksand, as a means of earning gil and building your reputation as a goldsmith.

※The next goldsmith quest will be available from Serendipity upon reaching level 15.
objectives: Present handfuls of copper rings to Serendipity.
Deliver the copper rings to Robert.

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: I'm so sorry, sir! Please don't─ Oh, it's only you, Forename! For a moment there, I thought my heart was about to fail me!

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: I thought the angry miner had returned. Gigi wasn't pleased with the ore the miner brought in, you see, and he made this sentiment clear...in the only way he knows how. There was mention of the miner's mother and an aldgoat─

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: A-Ahem! Never mind all that─I have an urgent task for you. We've just received an order for a prodigious quantity of copper rings, and I'd like you to handle it.

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: Now, this is an honest-to-gods commission, Forename. You'll have to satisfy a paying customer, not your kind and lovely guildmaster.

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: But I believe that you can do more than simply satisfy. Now, the customer's waiting, so you'd best get started on those copper rings. When they're ready, come and show them to me, just for good measure.

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: So, are the rings ready yet?

dialogue.name: GIGI
dialogue.text:
NE※GIGIGI★※...
CoPpEr...RiNgS...eH, i HaVe SeEn WoRsE.

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: Oh, Gigi, must you always be so─

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: ...Wait a minute. Did you just say that you've seen worse?

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: Forename! That's as good as a compliment, coming from him!

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: I mean, when you consider what a scathing critic he usually is, perhaps the fact he's not saying anything more insulting is a sign he likes it?

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: After all, he's called your previous work “utter garbage” and “an affront to the gods themselves.” I half expected him to call these rings abysmal failures!

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: Oh, I probably should take this opportunity to teach you a thing or two about what you made. Copper rings are...er, rings made out of copper. They can be used to make chains and...er, chainmail! <sigh> You probably already knew all that.

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: Anyway, Forename, I would like you to deliver these rings to the client personally. I would handle it myself, but I...I believe it's very important that you learn how to deal with customers firsthand!

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: The client is a Sultansworn named Robert, who should be waiting outside the guild right about now.

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: I told him he could wait inside, but he said he didn't want to distract the goldsmiths at their work. Not that I would mind a distraction like that...

dialogue.name: ROBERT
dialogue.text: You're a goldsmith, aren't you? Did Mistress Serendipity send you?

dialogue.name: ROBERT
dialogue.text: Yes, these shall serve nicely! Keeping the sultana from harm is perilous business, you see, and we Sultansworn can never have enough supplies to keep our equipment in serviceable condition.

dialogue.name: ROBERT
dialogue.text: You may inform Serendipity that she can expect full payment soon...and that I send her my fondest regards.

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: How did it go, Forename? What did he say about me─I mean, about your work?

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: ...Oh. Ahem. Anyway, seeing how well your very first commission went, I have high hopes for those to come.

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: In fact, why don't you speak with Eustace down at the Quicksand and see what work is available for a goldsmith?

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: Yes, I believe you're quite ready to handle commissions independent of my supervision. Take yourself to the Adventurers' Guild, and try taking on a task or two!

dialogue.name: ROBERT
dialogue.text: Do remember to send Mistress Serendipity my fondest regards. My thanks again for the copper rings.
